Class TicTacToeBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • TicTacToeBoard
  • public class TicTacToeBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    This file declares a class object TicTacToe board to act as the underlying game logic in the implementation of the game of Tic-Tac-Toe CSPC 224-01, Fall 2019 Programming Assignment #5 Sources:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TicTacToeBoard​(int playerN)  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void displayGrid()
      Method displays each cell in the grid as the tic tac toe game board
      java.lang.String getCellSymbol​(int row, int col)
      Method returns player token stored in the tic-tac-toe board cell specified by the user
      boolean isScratch()
      Method checks each Cell of the grid to determine if a scratch game has occurred - A scratch game is where every Cell of each grid is not empty ('-'), but no win pattern has occurred
      boolean isValidMove​(Coordinates coords)
      Method takes a Coordinates object and checks the corresponding Cell in grid to determine if the move is valid A move is valid if - The Coordinates object does not reference a cell that is already filled with a value - The Coordinates row and col 0 <= (row & col) <= N
      boolean isWinner​(char playerSymbol)
      Method checks each Cell of grid to determine if a winning pattern exists
      void makeMove​(Coordinates coords, char playerSymbol)
      Method takes a Coordinates object and sets the symbol of the corresponding cell with the player's symbol
      void populateGrid​(int N)
      Method populates grid with N number of Cell objects initialized with a '-' symbol

        public TicTacToeBoard​(int playerN)

    • Method Detail

      • displayGrid

        public void displayGrid()
        Method displays each cell in the grid as the tic tac toe game board

      • populateGrid

        public void populateGrid​(int N)
        Method populates grid with N number of Cell objects initialized with a '-' symbol
        Parameters:
        N - size of 2 dimensional cell array

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove​(Coordinates coords)
        Method takes a Coordinates object and checks the corresponding Cell in grid to determine if the move is valid A move is valid if - The Coordinates object does not reference a cell that is already filled with a value - The Coordinates row and col 0 <= (row & col) <= N
        Parameters:
        coords - Coordinates object that refers to Cell in grid
        Returns:
        boolean true if coords is a valid move, false otherwise

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove​(Coordinates coords,
                     char playerSymbol)
        Method takes a Coordinates object and sets the symbol of the corresponding cell with the player's symbol
        Parameters:
        coords - Coordinates object that corresponds with a Cell
        playerSymbol - char new symbol that replaces symbol of Cell object

      • isWinner

        public boolean isWinner​(char playerSymbol)
        Method checks each Cell of grid to determine if a winning pattern exists
        Parameters:
        playerSymbol - char symbol to be compared
        Returns:
        boolean true if a win pattern is recognized, false otherwise

      • isScratch

        public boolean isScratch()
        Method checks each Cell of the grid to determine if a scratch game has occurred - A scratch game is where every Cell of each grid is not empty ('-'), but no win pattern has occurred
        Returns:
        boolean true if scratch game conditions are satisfied, false otherwise

      • getCellSymbol

        public java.lang.String getCellSymbol​(int row,
                                      int col)
        Method returns player token stored in the tic-tac-toe board cell specified by the user
        Parameters:
        row - int user specified row in [0,2]
        col - int user specified col in [0,2]
        Returns:
        String representation of the player token in the specified shell
